result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

03:13 PM Defendant Christopher M Blume in court with attorney Charles W Giesen. Prosecuting Atty William Leroy Brown appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty;  bail continued. 

Partial discovery given to defense prior to prelim.  Defense rec'd some mental health records, premature to say how they will proceed.

03:27 PM  **CONTINUED PRELIMINARY HEARING from 6/14/2022**    REPORTER is Lynn Schultz.    Defendant in court with Attorney Charles W Giesen. Atty Giesen opposes bindover and asks court to dismiss charges; argument presented.  Rebuttal by State.  Response by Atty Giesen.  Court finds probable cause for bindover to Br 13 for further proceedings.  Parties request ARGN be held in Branch.

- Defendant shall report to the Dane County Jail to complete the booking/fingerprinting process within 10 days of today. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Jodi N or any family member of Jodi N or Julie N. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
